title: To-Do List Manager
description: Create a program to manage tasks with add, remove, and display features

steps.title: Create the task list
steps.instruction: Start with an empty list to store tasks.
steps.code:
# Create an empty list for tasks
tasks = []
print("To-Do List Manager Started!")

steps.title: Create add_task function
steps.instruction: Write a function that adds a task to the list.
steps.hint: Use the .append() method to add items to a list.
steps.code:
def add_task(tasks, task):
    """Add a new task to the list."""
    tasks.append(task)

steps.title: Create display_tasks function
steps.instruction: Write a function that shows all tasks with numbers.
steps.hint: Use enumerate() to get both the index and task. Start numbering at 1.

steps.title: Create remove_task function
steps.instruction: Write a function that removes a task by its position number.
steps.hint: Remember: list indexes start at 0, but users count from 1!

steps.title: Test your to-do list
steps.instruction: Use all the functions to add, display, and remove tasks.
steps.hint: Create a workflow that simulates using the to-do list.
steps.code:

add_task(tasks, "Learn Python")

solution:
# To-Do List Manager - Complete Solution

def add_task(tasks, task):
    """Add a new task to the list."""
    tasks.append(task)
    print(f"âœ… Added: '{task}'")

def display_tasks(tasks):
    """Display all tasks with numbers."""
    if not tasks:
        print("ğŸ“‹ No tasks yet!")
    else:
        print("\nğŸ“‹ Your Tasks:")
        for index, task in enumerate(tasks, start=1):
            print(f"{index}. {task}")
        print()

def remove_task(tasks, position):
    """Remove a task by its position number (1-indexed)."""
    if position < 1 or position > len(tasks):
        print("âŒ Invalid task number!")
    else:
        removed = tasks.pop(position - 1)
        print(f"ğŸ—‘ï¸  Removed: '{removed}'")

def clear_all_tasks(tasks):
    """Clear all tasks from the list."""
    tasks.clear()
    print("ğŸ§¹ All tasks cleared!")

# Main program
tasks = []

print("=== TO-DO LIST MANAGER ===")
print()

# Add tasks
add_task(tasks, "Buy groceries")
add_task(tasks, "Learn Python")
add_task(tasks, "Exercise for 30 minutes")
add_task(tasks, "Read a book")
add_task(tasks, "Call mom")

# Display all tasks
display_tasks(tasks)

# Remove some tasks
remove_task(tasks, 2)  # Remove "Learn Python"
remove_task(tasks, 4)  # Remove "Call mom"

# Display updated list
display_tasks(tasks)

# Add more tasks
add_task(tasks, "Finish homework")

# Final display
display_tasks(tasks)

print(f"Total tasks: {len(tasks)}")
